title: ‘Gauguin Portraits’ Review: A New Profile of a Familiar Face
text:
London

The boldly inventive portraits of the French artist Paul Gauguin (1848-1903) span the length of his career and evince his audacious, brilliant ambition. In likenesses of family, friends, provincial and Polynesian subjects, Gauguin captured his sitters’ characters and disparate contexts—but at times he defied the conventions of portraiture to provide a glimpse of far more. And as beautifully explored in “Gauguin Portraits,” a tightly focused show of about 50 works in an array of often- unorthodox media, the artist...
description: An exhibition at London’s National Gallery offers a fascinating journey through the painter’s esoteric life as presented by his portraiture.
